Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a basic place to stay and then move on!!”
Reviews.Author: greekcypriot2009
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I come to this hotel, again by a group on a trip visiting multiple countries. We stayed one night here this time and the booking was again made by a travel agency. It is supposed to be a 4* hotel but it is not. It is ok for 3 stars but it does not deserve the fourth one and I wonder why the star is still on. I canâ€™t say that the bed was comfortable and there was nothing to impress us. It is quite far from the main tourist sites, - a 45 minute drive to come to Venice. The hotel though is clean, but the staff is not that professional. Breakfast is continental. Restaurant food in the hotel was less than continental and if you come here with a group as we did, it is even worse. It was disappointing. Wi Fi internet connection is not free, and it is not that cheap as well if you decide to get a card. There is a bus stop near the hotel (bus route 2) going to Venice. I donâ€™t recommend this hotel to people who travel on their own for they should certainly book in Venice itself. Convenient though for groups who come in coaches and can park easily the coach in the parking lot. I can recommend it as a basic place to stay and then move on.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Albatros, Mestre, Venice”
Reviews.Author: 404Robert404
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice, and i was apprehensive as some of the reviews for this hotel were not good on this site. However, we were pleasantly surprised. We had a very large room in Art Deco style with an enourmous bed! Comfort of public areas was good, although the lighting in the restaurant, which doubled as a breakfast room was far too bright - More ambient, subdued lighting is needed for evening dining, and a slightly more extended and varied menu would be better too! Our room was situated at the rear of the hotel, and i think this was a bonus as the main road in front seemed quite noisy with a fair amount of traffic, we decided not to stay in Venice itself as we didn't want any noise disturbance. The Hotel advertised the bar was open until midnight, but on the second evening we decided to have a drink after dinner, but it was closed at 22.30! We asked reception if we could have a drink only to be told it was closed, but there was a bar across the road we could go to. I have to say it was open late every night after that, so maybe others complained! The staff in the restaurant and reception were helpful, and we found it a great base to stay. There is a bus stop about a minutes walk away and buses leave every 15 mins to take you into the centre of Venice which is around 20 mins away. All in all, a great four night stay, and i would reccommend this for a pleasant vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible cleanliness, bedbugs in at least two rooms”
Reviews.Author: NormaBriz
Reviews.Content: The general aspect pf the rooms old and dirty, we find a sock in the closet and bedbugs. The only answer that we received was that regarding the bedbugs it happen even in the best hotels (that's not true, I have a sister working in hotels services, and they had protocols for avoidance of bedbugs and other plagues, that they have to follow just after a room checkout), and about the dirtiness of the room, including the sock in the closet was fault of the cleaning people. We required from the hotel some mesure to assure that it wasn't bedbugs in our logagge and we received a negative answer from them, we neither received any kind of compensation. The worst service and cleanliness that I remember from any hotel. Believe me, there is no way that this hotel could be 4 stars, there are a lot of 3 stars hotel in much better conditions.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE - DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: UsLot2
Reviews.Content: This is definitely NOT a 4 star hotel - 2 at best. Decor is 50 years out of date, the place has a musty smell, furniture and carpets are stained, the shower floods the whole bathroom. Breakfast is VERY basic. Wi-Fi is charged, not free. Nothing within walking distance. No views. All in all for what it is, it's totally over-priced and falsely advertised. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with the stay”
Reviews.Author: sameasow
Reviews.Content: I and my wife stayed in the hotel for a day and night. I found it very quiet and family type hotel. The hotel was booked prior to my visit to Venice from the home country. And, the per night tariff was reasonable. The breakfast was excellent. The ACTV bus 2 can be used for traveling to Mestre or Venice. I will recommend this hotel to any family visiting Venice for a quiet stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal of one or two Days Only!”
Reviews.Author: greekcypriot2009
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at Albatros. It is supposed to be a 4* hotel but it should have been a 3* actually. We were with a group of 50 people and we came here because it was booked through a travel agency. Very basic and the reception staff not very helpful. I noticed that some of us got a suite while others not. It was a standard room they said. Ours was really big , comfortable and clean. It is not very long away from Venice but with the daily traffic it took us more than half an hour to get to Venice. The coach moved rather slowly. Continental breakfast and dinner very poor. You have to pay for internet access here which is something that I always demand in the hotels I book for myself if I travel alone. I donâ€™t think I would pick this hotel again when back to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - no complaints from us!”
Reviews.Author: CaseyLondon
Reviews.Content: Before we left for our Shearings tour of Italy, I looked up the Hotel Albatros on Trip Advisor and was very apprehensive when I read the reviews, so was expecting the worst! We had a nice, clean large room, the hotel was situated in a pleasant area, the food was fine and the staff friendly. My advice = Judge it for yourself...... Afterall, you can't please everyone all of the time!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away! Not even close to a 4star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cyclone_fan24
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 2 long nights while on a bus tour. It was the worst hotel on our tour. There were hairs on the bed and in the shower. We asked to move to a different room. Woke up in the morning with bug bites. Worse than a Motel 6! The pictures online are not anything like what our room looked like. Pro's: large towels, dinner was okay, lobby and dining room looks nice Con's: location, cleanliness, front desk staff, thin walls, poor breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Very expencive for its quality! Actually not in Venice. Very poor and absolutely not 4*”
Reviews.Author: Korinthios
Reviews.Content: It looks like a hotel from the East block! Rude staff, very poor breakfast and rooms without any character. It worths only to go to sleep after a very heavy daylong excursion at the amazing Venice.

Reviews.Title: “not too bad”
Reviews.Author: sjh911
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights at the end of a Cosmos tour and it was not bad. Of course its not right in Venice; that would be really expensive. Its right on the bus line, a short (15 min) ride and it was passable. If I return to Venice on my own, I will stay at this hotel because it is clean and affordable

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place!!”
Reviews.Author: missusmagic
Reviews.Content: The only thing going for this hotel is that it was clean. The staff were very rude & unhelpful. The food was awful to the point of being inedible. Walls of the rooms were paper thin & the charge of drinks at the bar was disgraceful .... Ten euros for two lemonaides, one topped up with fresh orange juice. There is a nice park near the hotel,but not much else.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of 4-stars”
Reviews.Author: welsh74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here aspart of a Cosmos tour. Nothing to do in the vicinity. Had an evening meal on the first night - very disappointing. Breakfast was basic. Staff were ok. Air-conditioning in room worked well. No useful outdoor space. Wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel. Location is not great.”
Reviews.Author: busorap
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our Cosmos trip to Italy. This hotel was nicer than some of the other Cosmos hotels. The room was spacious and clean. The food in the restaurant was pretty bad. The biggest downside is that it's on the mainland and it's a good 50 minute bus ride to make it to Venice, which is where all the key touristi sites are. I would only live here if it were via Cosmos or a tour. If you are travelling on your own, you'll be better off living in Venice itself.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a Four Star as Advertised”
Reviews.Author: Sri_NY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albatros for two nights as a part of a Cosmos tour to Italy & Greece. The hotel was relatively clean in comparison to some of the other hotels we stayed at as a part of this tour. The positives - Clean and quiet hotel. The negatives - Far away from Venice (bus no 2 is 45 - 50 mins to Venice), rude staff and a avoidable breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Way Out but Value for Money Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brahmasmi
Reviews.Content: Nice cosy, hotel about 15 KM from Venice. Bus Route No. 2 takes you to Venice. Being away from the city centre, the tariff is more affordable. Room was compact, clean. Breakfast was good standard continental type. The staff were efficient. No restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Venice is stunning, Hotel Albatros Mestre is not”
Reviews.Author: Eurofriends
Reviews.Content: We were part of a Trafalgar European tour group (cost-saver). We stayed at this hotel 2 nights and really spent minimal time in the room/hotel â€“ after all we were in Europe to sightsee! Hotelâ€™s positives - breakfast was okay (better than nothing) - dinner was average (not good, but not terrible either â€“ it was edible, although some people on the tour opted to eat in the restaurant across the street on the second night). - easy to get to from Venice (#2 bus, last stop). Get a map and directions from reception. Remember to ask when the last bus leaves from Piazzale Roma to the mainland. After 9pm it only comes every 30 minutes, and runs to about midnight. Can get lost walking from the Rialto Bridge to Piazzale Roma (takes 40 â€“ 60 minutes by foot, or take a vaporetto â€“ much quicker). Takes a total of 1.5 hours (if you walk and then take the bus). Hotelâ€™s negatives - room was small - air-conditioning did not work - bathroom was small - noisy from the restaurant(pizzeria)-goers across the street - understaffed at the reception desk, and those that are there take their time - required to leave the room key at reception every time you go out - several tours groups there simultaneously so it was really busy for porterage, breakfast and dinner - the coffee was pretty bad

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Albatros It's not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: Ladyopheliastar
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be no where near as bad as other reviews had suggested. Yes, it is in the suburbs and if you arrive on a Sunday the area is deserted as the locals go out for the day with their families The hotel exterior is unprepossessing and the reception is dated however, it is clean and bright. The room we stayed in was small but comfortable and clean. The air conditioning worked well. There were no real views to be had apart from other residences. The restaurant is clean and bright, the food provided as part of the tour was basic. Think school dinners! The food combinations wereâ€¦unusual. Such as roast pork, gravy and iceberg lettuce with grated carrot. (Opposite the hotel is a pizzeria.) When we arrived at the hotel it was mid afternoon and we needed lunch. The hotel does have a bar menu but, it was expensive. We ventured out despite other reviews claiming there is nothing we found a small Italian place. The locals went there to read the newspapers. We had a tasty cheese and ham â€˜toastâ€™ and drink for very little indeed. (Exit the hotel turn left, walk down the road towards the bus stop. The place is on the crossroads in front. 3 minutes walk.) Across the road is a small supermarket which will open on Monday morning just in time for you to pick up some provisions. Behind the hotel is a park with a childrenâ€™s playground in it, apart from this you could go for a walk or there is a small area outside the hotel where you can have a drink. There are quite a lot of mosquitoes around so bring some repellent. I must admit that if this is your first night on a Cosmos Tourama holiday in Italy it does feel like an anti climax, but if you are prepared for it you can treat it as part of the journey and make the most of it. I would like to add that it is very easy to travel to Venice by yourself. You can catch a bus on the road just down from the hotel they run regularly even on the Sunday and are inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here if you want to get some sleep!”
Reviews.Author: missyd17
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as part of a Cosmos tour. The twin room was of average size with a small bathroom with a decent shower. The room was not the cleanest room we have stayed in with some strange stains on the walls. The beds were very soft and sank in the middle when you slept. The main problem we had was the noise...you could hear EVERYTHING from the next rooms! I think this was made worse by the fact that one of the adjoining rooms had a door linking our room, that was locked but did not provide any sound proofing, you could even hear people talking quietly! Having no sleep when you are on a busy tour is not the best way to start your day. The local area is mainly residential but if you walk left out of the hotel for around 5- 10 mins you will find shops, restaurants etc. There is a supermarket across the road that opens at 08.30. Ate breakfast and dinner in the hotel both of poor standard...tinned fruit cocktail for breakfast anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some Cosmos hotel choices”
Reviews.Author: kathyitaly07
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a Cosmos tour group-small twin beds soft but tolerable for 3 nights. Kind of dirty and smokey. Actual eggs at breakfast buffet. Nice restaurant across the street that does not take credit cards. If I had a choice staying in Venice would be the best, the Albatros was just OK (my standards were lowered by the time we got here!)

Reviews.Title: “What were those stains?”
Reviews.Author: WI Boy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a Cosmos tour group. The room and bath were the largest we had in Italy. The corridor and room carpeting had numerous stains. A lot of cappuccino maybe? The front desk staff was friendly, but the woman in the breakfast room was over the top rude. I don't like sharing a table at breakfast, but they insist. The pizzaria across the steet is average and there didn't seem to be many alternatives. The hotel is remote, even from Mestre. It seemed like a long bus ride to Piazza Roma in Venice from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from Venice Island”
Reviews.Author: 1Eric-Cartman1
Reviews.Content: - Too far from Venice Island although bus service (1 Euro) is available in a short walking distance. 10 stops to Piazza Roma and 7 stops to Mestre Train Station - Too many mosquitoes in this area - Supermarket is right across the street - Big breakfast room, but no variety (plan yogurt (taste yucky), croissants, buns, red orange juice, coffee, tea, and ham). same everyday. - No free city map (3 Euros) - Key lock safety box in room - Double bed is 2 joint twin beds - Bathroom and bathtub are tiny - Don't eat at the pizza place right across the street (high cover charge with bad and slow service). No meat in salmon pasta.

HotelInfo.Name: Albatros Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Viale Don Luigi Sturzo, 32, 30171 Venice, Italy
